intro: Pyrularia olcifera, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a standout in the botanical world.
